name: fortinet-fortiproxy
label: Fortinet FortiProxy
description: This connector facilitates automated operation related to firwall policy, firewall address, firewall address group, firewall service group, and banned users.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiProxy server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key used to access the FortiProxy server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Firewall Policy
operations.description: Creates an firewall policy in FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy ID
parameters.name: policyid
parameters.description: ID of the policy whose firewall policy you want to create in FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Policy Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type of policy.   
explicit-web:Explicit Web Proxy policy   
transparent:Transparent firewall policy   
explicit-ftp:Explicit FTP Proxy policy   
ssh-tunnel:SSH Tunnel policy   
ssh:SSH policy   
access-proxy:Access Proxy   
wanopt:WANopt Tunnel

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Enable or disable this policy.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: Policy Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Policy name.

parameters.title: UUID
parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

parameters.title: Force Proxy
parameters.name: force-proxy
parameters.description:
Force proxy.   
enable:Force all TCP transparent traffic to proxy.   
disable:Do not force TCP transparent traffic to proxy.

parameters.title: Dynamic Bypass
parameters.name: dynamic-bypass
parameters.description:
Dynamic bypass.   
enable:Enable dynamic bypass to all HTTP traffic in this policy.   
disable:Disable dynamic bypass to all HTTP traffic in this policy.

parameters.title: Source Interface
parameters.name: srcintf
parameters.description: Incoming (ingress) interface.

parameters.title: Destination Interface
parameters.name: dstintf
parameters.description: Outgoing (egress) interface.

parameters.title: Source Address
parameters.name: srcaddr
parameters.description: Source address and address group names.

parameters.title: Destination Address
parameters.name: dstaddr
parameters.description: Destination address and address group names.

parameters.title: IPV6 Source Address
parameters.name: srcaddr6
parameters.description: IPv6 source address (web proxy only).

parameters.title: IPV6 Destination Address
parameters.name: dstaddr6
parameters.description: IPv6 destination address (web proxy only).

parameters.title: Policy Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
Policy action (allow/deny).   
accept:Allows session that match the firewall policy.   
deny:Blocks sessions that match the firewall policy.   
redirect:Redirect sessions that match the firewall policy to a url.   
isolate:Isolate sessions that match the firewall policy with isolator.

parameters.title: Schedule Name
parameters.name: schedule
parameters.description: Schedule name.

parameters.title: Service
parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Service and service group names.

parameters.title: Explicit Web Proxy
parameters.name: explicit-web-proxy
parameters.description: Explicit web proxy.

parameters.title: Transparent
parameters.name: transparent
parameters.description:
set webproxy to use original client address.   
enable:Enable using original client address for webproxy.   
disable:Disable using original client address for webproxy.

parameters.title: Access Proxy
parameters.name: access-proxy
parameters.description: Access Proxy.

parameters.title: ZTNA Status
parameters.name: ztna-status
parameters.description:
Enable/disable zero trust access.   
enable:Enable zero trust network access.   
disable:Disable zero trust network access.

parameters.title: ZTNA EMS Tag
parameters.name: ztna-ems-tag
parameters.description: Source ztna-ems-tag names.

parameters.title: ZTNA GEO Tag
parameters.name: ztna-geo-tag
parameters.description: Source ztna-geo-tag names.

parameters.title: Internet Service
parameters.name: internet-service
parameters.description:
Enable/disable use of Internet Services for this policy. If enabled, destination address and service are not used.    
enable:Enable use of Internet Services in policy.   
disable:Disable use of Internet Services in policy.

parameters.title: Internet Service Name
parameters.name: internet-service-name
parameters.description: Internet Service name.

parameters.title: Internet Service Custom
parameters.name: internet-service-custom
parameters.description: Custom Internet Service Name.

parameters.title: UTM Status
parameters.name: utm-status
parameters.description:
Enable to add one or more security profiles (AV, IPS, etc.) to the firewall policy.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: WebProxy Profile
parameters.name: webproxy-profile
parameters.description: Web proxy profile using when none matched policy.

parameters.title: Log Traffic
parameters.name: logtraffic
parameters.description:
Enable or disable logging. Log all sessions or security profile sessions.   
all:Log all sessions accepted or denied by this policy.   
utm:Log traffic that has a security profile applied to it.   
disable:Disable all logging for this policy.

parameters.title: Log Traffic Start
parameters.name: logtraffic-start
parameters.description:
Record logs when a session starts and ends.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: Log HTTP Transaction
parameters.name: log-http-transaction
parameters.description:
Enable/disable http transaction log.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: WAN Optimization
parameters.name: wanopt
parameters.description:
Enable/disable WAN optimization.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: WAN Optimization Detection
parameters.name: wanopt-detection
parameters.description:
WAN optimization auto-detection mode.   
active:Active WAN optimization peer auto-detection.   
passive:Passive WAN optimization peer auto-detection.   
off:Turn off WAN optimization peer auto-detection.

parameters.title: WAN Optimization Passive Mode
parameters.name: wanopt-passive-opt
parameters.description:
WAN optimization passive mode options. This option decides what IP address will be used to connect server.   
default:Allow client side WAN opt peer to decide.   
transparent:Use address of client to connect to server.   
non-transparent:Use local FortiProxy address to connect to server.

parameters.title: WAN Optimization Profile
parameters.name: wanopt-profile
parameters.description: WAN optimization profile.

parameters.title: WAN Optimization Peer
parameters.name: wanopt-profile
parameters.description: WAN optimization peer.

parameters.title: Web Cache
parameters.name: webcache
parameters.description:
Enable/disable web cache.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: Web Cache HTTPS
parameters.name: webcache-https
parameters.description:
Enable/disable web cache for HTTPS.   
disable:Disable web cache for HTTPS.   
enable:Enable web cache for HTTPS.

parameters.title: Reverse Cache
parameters.name: reverse-cache
parameters.description:
Enable/disable reverse cache servers.   
disable:Disable reverse cache.   
enable:Enable reverse cache servers.

parameters.title: HTTP Tunnel Authentication
parameters.name: http-tunnel-auth
parameters.description:
Enable/disable HTTP tunnel authentication.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: SSH Policy Redirect
parameters.name: ssh-policy-redirect
parameters.description:
Redirect SSH traffic to match ssh policy.   
enable:Enable SSH policy redirect.   
disable:Disable SSH policy redirect.

parameters.title: WebProxy Forward
parameters.name: webproxy-forward-server
parameters.description: Webproxy forward server name.

parameters.title: Isolator Server Name
parameters.name: isolator-server
parameters.description: isolator server name.

parameters.title: IP Pool Name
parameters.name: poolname
parameters.description: Name of IP pool object.

parameters.title: User Groups
parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Names of user groups that can authenticate with this policy.

parameters.title: Users
parameters.name: users
parameters.description: Names of individual users that can authenticate with this policy.

parameters.title: WebProxy Disclaimer
parameters.name: disclaimer
parameters.description:
Web proxy disclaimer setting: by domain, policy, or user.   
disable:Disable disclaimer.   
domain:Display disclaimer for domain   
policy:Display disclaimer for policy   
user:Display disclaimer for current user

parameters.title: Comments
parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Comment.

parameters.title: Redirect URL
parameters.name: redirect-url
parameters.description: Redirect URL for further web proxy processing.

parameters.title: Custom Log Fields
parameters.name: custom-log-fields
parameters.description: Custom fields to append to log messages for this policy.

parameters.title: Override Replacement Message
parameters.name: replacemsg-override-group
parameters.description: Override the default replacement message group for this policy.

parameters.title: Source Address Negate
parameters.name: srcaddr-negate
parameters.description:
When enabled srcaddr specifies what the source address must NOT be.   
enable:Enable source address negate.   
disable:Disable source address negate.

parameters.title: Destination Address Negate
parameters.name: dstaddr-negate
parameters.description:
When enabled dstaddr specifies what the destination address must NOT be.   
enable:Enable destination address negate.   
disable:Disable destination address negate.

parameters.title: Service Negate
parameters.name: service-negate
parameters.description:
When enabled service specifies what the service must NOT be.   
enable:Enable negated service match.   
disable:Disable negated service match.

parameters.title: Internet Service Negate
parameters.name: internet-service-negate
parameters.description:
When enabled internet-service specifies what the service must NOT be.   
enable:Enable negated Internet Service match.   
disable:Disable negated Internet Service match.

parameters.title: Decrypted Traffic Mirror
parameters.name: decrypted-traffic-mirror
parameters.description: Decrypted traffic mirror.

parameters.title: UTM Sessions
parameters.name: max-session-per-user
parameters.description: Max UTM sessions per user.

parameters.title: Profile Type
parameters.name: profile-type
parameters.description:
Determine whether the firewall policy allows security profile groups or single profiles only.   
single:Do not allow security profile groups.   
group:Allow security profile groups.

parameters.title: Profile Group
parameters.name: profile-group
parameters.description: Name of profile group.

parameters.title: Profile Protocol
parameters.name: profile-protocol-options
parameters.description: Name of an existing Protocol options profile.

parameters.title: SSL SSH Profile
parameters.name: ssl-ssh-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing SSL SSH profile.

parameters.title: Antivirus Profile
parameters.name: av-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing Antivirus profile.

parameters.title: Image Analyzer Profile
parameters.name: ia-profile
parameters.description: Image analyzer profile.

parameters.title: Web Filter Profile
parameters.name: webfilter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing Web filter profile.

parameters.title: DNS Filter Profile
parameters.name: dnsfilter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing DNS filter profile.

parameters.title: Email Filter Profile
parameters.name: emailfilter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing email filter profile.

parameters.title: DLP Sensor
parameters.name: dlp-sensor
parameters.description: Name of an existing DLP sensor.

parameters.title: File Filter Profile
parameters.name: file-filter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing file-filter profile.

parameters.title: IPS Sensor
parameters.name: ips-sensor
parameters.description: Name of an existing IPS sensor.

parameters.title: Application List
parameters.name: application-list
parameters.description: Name of an existing Application list.

parameters.title: ICAP Profile
parameters.name: icap-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing ICAP profile.

parameters.title: CIFS Profile
parameters.name: cifs-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing CIFS profile.

parameters.title: VideoFilter Profile
parameters.name: videofilter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing VideoFilter profile.

parameters.title: SSH Filter Profile
parameters.name: ssh-filter-profile
parameters.description: Name of an existing SSH filter profile.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.title: New Resource ID
parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

operations.title: Get Firewall Policy
operations.description: Retrieves all firewall policy from FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Data Source
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting entry index.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.title: With Meta
parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.title: Contents Hash
parameters.name: with_contents_hash
parameters.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

parameters.title: Skip
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.title: Format
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

parameters.title: Key
parameters.name: key
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

parameters.title: Pattern
parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

parameters.title: Scope
parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.title: Exclude Default Values
parameters.name: exclude-default-values
parameters.description: Exclude properties/objects with default value

parameters.title: Meta Only
parameters.name: meta_only
parameters.description: When turned on, the total filtered count (based on the filter params) and table size will be returned, and table entries won't be emitted to results. The flag should only be used when fetching table type datasource and the filter isn't on masterkey.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

operations.title: Get Firewall Policy Details
operations.description: Retrieves an specific firewall policy from FortiProxy server based on the policy ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy ID
parameters.name: policyid
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.title: Data Source
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.title: Include Meta Information
parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.title: Skip
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.title: Format
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

ssh-tunnel:SSH Tunnel policy   
ssh:SSH policy   
access-proxy:Access Proxy   
wanopt:WANopt Tunnel

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Before
parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.title: After
parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.title: Address Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type of address.

iprange:Range of IPv4 addresses between two specified addresses (inclusive).

geography:IP addresses from a specified country.

dynamic:Dynamic address object.   
interface-subnet:IP and subnet of interface.   
mac:Range of MAC addresses.

healthy:HEALTHY.   
quarantine:QUARANTINE.   
checkup:CHECKUP.   
transient:TRANSIENT.   
infected:INFECTED.

operations.title: Get Firewall Address
operations.description: Retrieves all firewall address from FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Data Source
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting entry index.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.title: Include Meta Information
parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.title: Include Contents Hash
parameters.name: with_contents_hash
parameters.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

parameters.title: Skip
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.title: Format
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

parameters.title: Filter on Property
parameters.name: key
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

parameters.title: Pattern
parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

parameters.title: Scope
parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.title: Exclude Properties
parameters.name: exclude-default-values
parameters.description: Exclude properties/objects with default value

parameters.title: Meta Only
parameters.name: meta_only
parameters.description: When turned on, the total filtered count (based on the filter params) and table size will be returned, and table entries won't be emitted to results. The flag should only be used when fetching table type datasource and the filter isn't on masterkey.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

folder:Address folder group (members may not belong to any other group).

parameters.title: Category
parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
Address group category.   
default:Default address group category (cannot be used as ztna-ems-tag/ztna-geo-tag in policy).   
ztna-ems-tag:Members must be ztna-ems-tag group or ems-tag address, can be used as ztna-ems-tag in policy.   
ztna-geo-tag:Members must be ztna-geo-tag group or geographic address, can be used as ztna-geo-tag in policy.

vdom=* (All VDOMs)

operations.title: Get Firewall Address Group Details
operations.description: Retrieves an specific firewall address group from FortiProxy server based on the address group name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Address Group Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Address group name.

parameters.title: Data Source
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.title: Meta Information
parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.title: Skip
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.title: Format
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

operations.title: Update Firewall Address Group
operations.description: Updates an firewall address group in FortiProxy server based on the address group name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Address Group Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Address group name.

parameters.title: Address Group Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Address group type.   
default:Default address group type (address may belong to multiple groups).   
folder:Address folder group (members may not belong to any other group).

parameters.title: Category
parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
Address group category.   
default:Default address group category (cannot be used as ztna-ems-tag/ztna-geo-tag in policy).   
ztna-ems-tag:Members must be ztna-ems-tag group or ems-tag address, can be used as ztna-ems-tag in policy.   
ztna-geo-tag:Members must be ztna-geo-tag group or geographic address, can be used as ztna-geo-tag in policy.

parameters.title: UUID
parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

parameters.title: Member
parameters.name: member
parameters.description: Address objects contained within the group.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment.

parameters.title: Exclude Address
parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description:
Enable/disable address exclusion.   
enable:Enable address exclusion.   
disable:Disable address exclusion.

parameters.title: Exclude Member
parameters.name: exclude-member
parameters.description: Address exclusion member.

parameters.title: Color
parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of icon on the GUI.

parameters.title: Tagging
parameters.name: tagging
parameters.description: Config object tagging.

parameters.title: Allow Routing
parameters.name: allow-routing
parameters.description:
Enable/disable use of this group in the static route configuration.   
enable:Enable use of this group in the static route configuration.   
disable:Disable use of this group in the static route configuration.

parameters.title: Security Fabric Object
parameters.name: fabric-object
parameters.description:
Security Fabric global object setting.   
enable:Object is set as a security fabric-wide global object.   
disable:Object is local to this security fabric member.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.title: Before
parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.title: After
parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.title: Address Group Name

parameters.description: Enable\/disable web proxy service group.   \nenable:Enable setting.   \ndisable:Disable setting.

parameters.title: Member
parameters.name: member
parameters.description: Address objects contained within the group.

parameters.title: Color
parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of icon on the GUI.

parameters.title: Security Fabric Object
parameters.name: fabric-object
parameters.description:
Security Fabric global object setting.   
enable:Object is set as a security fabric-wide global object.   
disable:Object is local to this security fabric member.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.title: New Resource ID
parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

operations.title: Get Firewall Service Group
operations.description: Retrieves all firewall service group from FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Data Source
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting entry index.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.title: Meta Information
parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.title: Include Contents Hash
parameters.name: with_contents_hash
parameters.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

parameters.title: Skip
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.title: Include Property
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

parameters.title: Filter on Property
parameters.name: key
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

parameters.title: Pattern
parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

parameters.title: Scope
parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.title: Exclude Properties
parameters.name: exclude-default-values
parameters.description: Exclude properties/objects with default value

parameters.title: Meta Only
parameters.name: meta_only
parameters.description: When turned on, the total filtered count (based on the filter params) and table size will be returned, and table entries won't be emitted to results. The flag should only be used when fetching table type datasource and the filter isn't on masterkey.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

operations.title: Get Authenticated Firewall Users List
operations.description: Retrieves all authenticated firewall users of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting entry index.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.title: Include IPV4 Users
parameters.name: ipv4
parameters.description: Include IPv4 user (default=true).

parameters.title: Include IPV6 Users
parameters.name: ipv6
parameters.description: Include IPv6 users.

operations.title: DeAuthenticate Firewall Users
operations.description: Retrieves all de-authenticated firewall users of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy server based on the user type, user ID, IP address, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: User Type
parameters.name: user_type
parameters.description: User type [proxy|firewall]. Required for both proxy and firewall users.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID. Required for both proxy and firewall users.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: User IP address. Required for both proxy and firewall users.

parameters.title: IP Version
parameters.name: ip_version
parameters.description: IP version [ip4|ip6]. Only required if user_type is firewall.

parameters.title: Authentication Method
parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Authentication method [fsso|rsso|ntlm|firewall|wsso|fsso_citrix|sso_guest]. Only required if user_type is firewall.

parameters.title: DeAuthenticate All Users
parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Set to true to deauthenticate all users. Other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.title: Users
parameters.name: users
parameters.description: Array of user objects to deauthenticate. Use this to deauthenticate multiple users at once. Each object should include the above properties.

operations.title: Get All Banned Users List
operations.description: Retrieves list of all banned users of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy.

operations.title: Add Users to Banned List
operations.description: Add users to banned list of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy based on the IP addresses and expiry that you have specified.

parameters.title: IP Addresses
parameters.name: ip_addresses
parameters.description: List of IP Addresses to ban. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are allowed.

parameters.title: Expiry
parameters.name: expiry
parameters.description: Time until expiry in seconds. 0 for indefinite ban.

operations.title: Clear All Banned Users List
operations.description: Clear list of all banned users of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy.

operations.title: Clear Banned Users List by IP
operations.description: Clear list of all banned users by IP's of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy based on the IP addresses that you have specified.

parameters.title: IP Addresses
parameters.name: ip_addresses
parameters.description: List of banned user IPs to clear. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are allowed.
